meanings.definition: To make something international in character or scope.
meanings.sent1: Our company is internationalising its operations to reach customers worldwide.
meanings.sent2: The organization is internationalising its efforts to collaborate with partners from different countries.
meanings.sent3: The chef internationalised the menu by adding dishes from various cultures.
meanings.sent4: Her music has the power to internationalise emotions and connect people from all over the world.
meanings.sent5: By internationalising our approach, we can learn from diverse perspectives and grow as a team.

meanings.definition: To extend to or involve other countries or nations.
meanings.sent1: The company is internationalising its supply chain to include vendors from different countries.
meanings.sent2: The project is internationalising its reach by partnering with organizations across the globe.
meanings.sent3: The children's game of tag internationalised when players from different countries joined in.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork has the ability to internationalise cultural influences and create a global impact.
meanings.sent5: Internationalising our trade agreements can lead to mutual benefits for all participating nations.
